monster.name: Adult Time Dragon
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 50, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Turn of Fortune's Wheel

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Rreactive
trait.text: The dragon can take up to three reactions per round but only one per turn.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The dragon makes three Rend attacks.

action.name: Rend
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d6 + 7) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) force damage.

action.name: Time Breath (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The dragon exhales a wave of shimmering light in a 60-foot cone. Nonmagical objects and vegetation in that area that aren't being worn or carried crumble to dust. Each creature in that area must make a DC 20 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 36 (8d8) force damage and is magically weakened as it is desynchronized from the time stream. While the creature is in this state, attack rolls against it have advantage, and it has the poisoned condition. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only. A weakened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself after it succeeds on three of these saves.

reaction.name: Reactive Rend
reaction.text: After using Legendary Resistance or in response to being hit by an attack roll, the dragon makes one Rend attack.

reaction.name: Slow Time
reaction.text: Immediately after a creature the dragon can see ends its turn, the dragon targets a creature it can see within 60 feet of itself that is weakened by its Time Breath. Until the weakened effect ends on the target, its speed becomes 0, and its speed can't increase.

reaction.name: Time Slip
reaction.text: The dragon halves the damage it takes from an attack made against it, provided it can see the attacker. The dragon can then immediately teleport, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

monster.name: Ancient Time Dragon
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 48, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Turn of Fortune's Wheel

trait.name: Cycle of Rebirth
trait.text: If the dragon dies, its soul coalesces into a steely egg and teleports to a random plane of existence. The egg is immune to all damage and hatches into a time dragon wyrmling after 1d100 years. The dragon retains all memories and knowledge it gained in its previous life.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
trait.text: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Reactive
trait.text: The dragon can take up to three reactions per round but only one per turn.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The dragon makes three Rend attacks.

action.name: Rend
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (3d8 + 9) slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) force damage.

action.name: Time Breath (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The dragon exhales a wave of shimmering light in a 90-foot cone. Nonmagical objects and vegetation in that area that aren't being worn or carried crumble to dust. Each creature in that area must make a DC 24 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 52 (8d12) force damage and is magically weakened as it is desynchronized from the time stream. While the creature is in this state, attack rolls against it have advantage, it has the poisoned condition, and other creatures have resistance to all damage it deals. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only. A weakened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself after it succeeds on three of these saves.

action.name: Time Gate (1/Day)
action.text: The dragon conjures a 20-foot-diameter, circular portal in the space between its horns or in an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet of itself. The portal links to a precise location on any plane of existence at a point in time up to 8,000 years from the present, whether past or future. The portal lasts for 24 hours or until the dragon's concentration ends (as if concentration on a spell). The portal has a front and a back on each plane where it appears. Travel through the portal is possible only by moving through its front. Anything that does so is transported to the destination, appearing in the unoccupied space nearest to the portal. Deities and other planar rulers can prevent portals created by the dragon from opening in the rulers' presence or anywhere within their domains.

reaction.name: Reactive Rend
reaction.text: After using Legendary Resistance or in response to being hit by an attack roll, the dragon makes one Rend attack.

reaction.name: Slow Time
reaction.text: Immediately after a creature the dragon can see ends its turn, the dragon targets a creature it can see within 90 feet of itself that is weakened by its Time Breath. Until the weakened effect ends on the target, its speed becomes 0, and its speed can't increase.

reaction.name: Time Slip
reaction.text: The dragon halves the damage it takes from an attack made against it, provided it can see the attacker. The dragon can then immediately teleport, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

monster.name: Athar Null
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 53, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Turn of Fortune's Wheel

trait.name: Avoidance
trait.text: If the null is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take half as much damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and half as much damage if it fails.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The null makes two Force Dagger attacks.

action.name: Force Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 13 (3d8) force damage. Hit or Miss: The dagger magically returns to the null's hand immediately after a ranged attack.

action.name: Defier's Whim (Bonus Action)
action.text: The null takes the Dash, Disengage, or Use an Object action.

reaction.name: Nullify Spell (3/Day)
reaction.text: The null utters a magical word of cancelation to interrupt a creature it can see that is casting a spell. If the spell is 3rd level or lower, it fails and has no effect. If the spell is 4th level or higher, the null makes an Intelligence check (DC 10 + the spell's level). On a successful check, the spell fails and has no effect.

monster.name: Aurumach Rilmani
monster.resist: psychic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 43

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The aurumach makes three Manifested Blade or Gleaming Ray attacks.

action.name: Manifested Blade
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 23 (4d8 + 5) force damage.

action.name: Gleaming Ray
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +11 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 24 (3d12 + 5) force damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The aurumach casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 19):
• At will: detect magic, detect thoughts • 1/Day each: fly, geas (as an action), slow, suggestion

action.name: Aura of Blades (Bonus Action)
action.text: The aurumach manifests a spectral, golden aura of blades around itself. While this aura is manifested, each creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the aurumach must make a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw, taking 16 (3d10) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The aura disappears after 1 minute, when the aurumach has the incapacitated condition or dies, or when the aurumach uses a bonus action to end it.

action.name: Invoke Weakness (Recharge 5-6) (Bonus Action)
action.text: The aurumach attempts to use its magic to weaken the defenses of a creature it can see within 120 feet of itself. The target must succeed on a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw or become cursed until the end of the aurumach's next turn. The next time the aurumach hits the cursed target with a Manifested Blade or Gleaming Ray attack, the target takes an extra 27 (6d8) force damage.

monster.spells: detect magic, detect thoughts, fly, geas, slow, suggestion

monster.name: Avoral Guardinal
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 32, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands

trait.name: Dive Attack
trait.text: If the avoral is flying, dives at least 30 feet in a straight line toward a Medium or smaller creature, and ends within 5 feet of it, that creature must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or take 14 (4d6) piercing damage and have the prone condition.

trait.name: Flyby
trait.text: The avoral doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The avoral makes two Talon attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Talon
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 13 (2d12) radiant damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The avoral casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16):
• 1/Day each: command, hold person

monster.spells: command, hold person

monster.name: Baernaloth
monster.resist: cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, psychic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 20, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Turn of Fortune's Wheel

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
trait.text: If the baernaloth fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The baernaloth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Reactive
trait.text: The baernaloth can take up to three reactions per round but only one per turn.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The baernaloth makes one Anguishing Bite attack and one Claw attack. It can also use Teleport.

action.name: Anguishing Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) psychic damage. If the target is a creature, it can't regain hit points until the start of the baernaloth's next turn.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 17 (5d6) necrotic damage.

action.name: Miasma of Discord (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The baernaloth exhales gray vapors that coalesce at a point it can see within 120 feet of itself. The vapors fill a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point, then vanish. Each non-yugoloth creature in that area must make a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 35 (10d6) psychic damage and has the charmed condition until the end of its next turn. A creature charmed in this way treats its allies as foes, and the colors of its body and equipment become shades of gray. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The baernaloth casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 20):
• At will: detect thoughts, phantasmal force, suggestion • 1/Day each: cloudkill, plane shift (self only), scrying (as an action)

action.name: Summon Yugoloth (1/Day)
action.text: The baernaloth has a 50 percent chance of summoning its choice of 1d4 mezzoloths, 1 arcanaloth, or 1 baernaloth (the mezzoloth and arcanaloth appear in the Monster Manual). A summoned yugoloth appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of the baernaloth, acts as an ally of the baernaloth, and can't summon other yugoloths. It remains for 1 minute, until it or the baernaloth dies, or until the baernaloth dismisses it as an action.

action.name: Teleport
action.text: The baernaloth teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

reaction.name: Afflict Despair
reaction.text: When a creature that the baernaloth can see within 60 feet of itself hits with an attack roll or succeeds on a saving throw, the baernaloth forces the creature to reroll the d20 and use the new result.

reaction.name: Inescapable Pain
reaction.text: When the baernaloth is damaged by another creature, that creature must make a DC 19 Constitution saving throw, taking 14 (4d6) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.spells: detect thoughts, phantasmal force, suggestion, cloudkill, plane shift, scrying

monster.name: Bariaur Wanderer
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 21, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Turn of Fortune's Wheel

trait.name: Portal Sense
trait.text: The bariaur can sense the presence of portals within 30 feet of itself, including inactive portals, and instinctively knows the destination of each one. The bariaur knows the distance and direction to the last portal it used as long as they're on the same plane.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The bariaur makes two Barbed Javelin or Shortbow attacks.

action.name: Barbed Javelin
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, its speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of the bariaur's next turn.

action.name: Ram
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the bariaur moved at least 20 feet straight toward the target immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 10 (3d6) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or have the prone condition.

action.name: Shortbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, plus 4 (1d8) piercing damage if the target doesn't have all its hit points.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The bariaur casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability:
• At will: dancing lights, druidcraft • 1/Day each: goodberry, pass without trace, tongues

action.name: Mighty Leap (Bonus Action)
action.text: The bariaur jumps a distance up to its walking speed.

monster.spells: dancing lights, druidcraft, goodberry, pass without trace, tongues

monster.name: Bleak Cabal Void Soother
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 54, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Turn of Fortune's Wheel

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The void soother makes two Mace or Void Bolt attacks.

action.name: Mace
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) force damage.

action.name: Void Bolt
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +4 to hit, range 90 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d8) force damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The void soother casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 12):
• At will: guidance, light • 1/Day each: calm emotions, lesser restoration, remove curse, protection from energy

action.name: Soothing Word (3/Day) (Bonus Action)
action.text: The void soother speaks a magical word of mercy, healing one creature it can see within 60 feet of itself. The target regains 4 (1d4 + 2) hit points.

monster.spells: guidance, light, calm emotions, lesser restoration, remove curse, protection from energy

monster.name: Cranium Rat Squeaker
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 22, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Turn of Fortune's Wheel

trait.name: Shared Telepathy
trait.text: Any creature touching the cranium rat can use the rat's telepathy if the rat allows it. If the creature knows any language, the creature can use the telepathy to communicate words and emotions.

trait.name: Telepathic Shroud
trait.text: The cranium rat is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as to divination spells.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

action.name: Illumination (Bonus Action)
action.text: The cranium rat sheds dim light from its exposed brain in a 5-foot radius or extinguishes the light.

monster.name: Cranium Rat Squeaker Swarm
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained, stunned
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 22, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Turn of Fortune's Wheel

trait.name: Psychic Messenger
trait.text: The swarm can use its sending spell to target someone familiar to a creature in telepathic contact with the swarm.

trait.name: Swarm
trait.text: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny rat. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

trait.name: Telepathic Shroud
trait.text: The swarm is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as to divination spells.

action.name: Bites
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. Hit: 14 (4d6) piercing damage, or 7 (2d6) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer, plus 22 (5d8) psychic damage.

action.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
action.text:
The swarm casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):
• At will: command*, detect thoughts*, sending* • 1/Day each: confusion*, dominate monster*
*To cast this spell, the swarm must have more than half its hit points remaining.

action.name: Illumination (Bonus Action)
action.text: The swarm sheds dim light from its brains in a 5-foot radius, increases the illumination to bright light in a 5- to 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional number of feet equal to the chosen radius, or extinguishes the light.

monster.spells: command, detect thoughts, sending, confusion, dominate monster

monster.name: Cuprilach Rilmani
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 44, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Turn of Fortune's Wheel

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The cuprilach makes three Burnished Blade or Bolt attacks.

action.name: Burnished Blade
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) piercing damage plus 13 (2d12) psychic damage.

action.name: Bolt
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d4 + 5) piercing damage plus 13 (2d12) psychic damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The cuprilach casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):
• At will: detect magic, disguise self • 1/Day each: alter self, fog cloud, silence

action.name: Assassin's Agility (Bonus Action)
action.text: The cuprilach takes the Dash or Disengage action, or it makes one Burnished Blade attack.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
reaction.text: The cuprilach halves the damage it takes from an attack that hits it, provided it can see the attacker.

monster.spells: detect magic, disguise self, alter self, fog cloud, silence

monster.name: Dabus
monster.languages: understands all languages but can't speak; communicates via Symbol Speech
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 23, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Turn of Fortune's Wheel

trait.name: Physical Restraint
trait.text: The dabus doesn't make melee attacks or opportunity attacks, even in self-defense.

trait.name: Symbol Speech
trait.text: A dabus communicates by creating illusory symbols and pictures that float in the air in front of itself and disappear a few seconds later. A creature that can see such a message can decipher it with a successful DC 10 Intelligence (Investigation) check (no action required).

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The dabus makes two Flying Brick attacks.

action.name: Flying Brick
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range 90 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Grasping Ground (Recharge 6)
action.text: The dabus causes a 20-foot-square area of ground it can see within 60 feet of itself to sprout clutching appendages made of stone. Each creature of the dabus's choice in that area must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or take 9 (2d8) bludgeoning damage and have the grappled condition (escape DC 13). While grappled in this way, the creature has the restrained condition. The appendages vanish after 1 minute or if the dabus's concentration ends (as if concentration on a spell).

monster.name: Darkweaver
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 25, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Turn of Fortune's Wheel

trait.name: Shadowy Form
trait.text: While the darkweaver is in dim light or darkness, attack rolls against it are made with disadvantage unless the darkweaver has the incapacitated condition.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The darkweaver can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
trait.text: The darkweaver takes 10 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The darkweaver makes two Shadow Web attacks and one Bite attack. It can use Reel after any of these attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (3d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 17 (5d6) necrotic damage, and if the target is a creature, the target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

action.name: Shadow Web
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 120 ft., one creature. Hit: 16 (3d10) necrotic damage, and the target has the grappled condition (escape DC 15). The shadow web can be attacked and destroyed (AC 16; 20 hit points; vulnerability to radiant damage; immunity to bludgeoning, necrotic, poison, and psychic damage). The darkweaver can grapple up to six creatures at a time using its shadow web.

action.name: Reel
action.text: The darkweaver pulls each creature it has grappled up to 60 feet toward itself.

monster.name: Decaton Modron
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 36, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Turn of Fortune's Wheel

trait.name: Axiomatic Mind
trait.text: The decaton can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

trait.name: Combat Ready
trait.text: The decaton has advantage on initiative rolls.

trait.name: Disintegration
trait.text: If the decaton dies, its body disintegrates into dust, leaving behind anything it was carrying.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The decaton makes three Tentacle attacks.

action.name: Tentacle
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) piercing damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the grappled condition (escape DC 14). Until this grapple ends, the decaton can't use this tentacle against other targets. The decaton has ten tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

action.name: Lightning Rays (Recharge 6)
action.text: The decaton unleashes a barrage of lightning bolts from its eyes. Each creature within 30 feet of the decaton must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 38 (7d10) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful save.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The decaton casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):
• At will: detect magic, dispel magic, mending (as an action) • 1/Day each: plane shift (self only), protection from evil and good

monster.spells: detect magic, dispel magic, mending, plane shift, protection from evil and good

monster.name: Doomguard Doom Lord
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 54, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands

trait.name: Aura of Doom
trait.text: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the doom lord must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the doom lord doesn't have the incapacitated condition, it can suppress or resume this aura at the start of its turn (no action required).

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: The doom lord deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The doom lord makes two Entropic Greatsword or Entropic Javelin attacks.

action.name: Entropic Greatsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. A creature killed by this attack has its body and everything it is wearing or carrying, except for magic items, reduced to ash.

action.name: Entropic Javelin
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) necrotic damage. A creature killed by this attack has its body and everything it is wearing or carrying, except for magic items, reduced to ash.

monster.name: Doomguard Rot Blade
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 56, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Turn of Fortune's Wheel

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The rot blade makes two Entropic Blade or Entropic Javelin attacks.

action.name: Entropic Blade
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage. A creature killed by this attack has its body and everything it is wearing or carrying, except for magic items, reduced to ash. Hit or Miss: The rot blade can cause the blade to emit a burst of entropic magic in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on the weapon. Each creature in that area other than the rot blade must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or take 6 (1d12) necrotic damage. The blade can emit entropic magic in this way only once per turn.

action.name: Entropic Javelin
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 13 (2d12) necrotic damage. A creature killed by this attack has its body and everything it is wearing or carrying, except for magic items, reduced to ash.

monster.name: Eater of Knowledge
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 29, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Turn of Fortune's Wheel

trait.name: Brains Devoured
trait.text: When the eater of knowledge is first encountered, roll 1d10 to determine the number of brains it has already consumed.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The eater of knowledge has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The eater of knowledge makes two Slam attacks. If both attacks hit the same creature and the target is Large or smaller, it has the grappled condition (escape DC 14) and must succeed on a DC 15 Intelligence saving throw or have the stunned condition until the grapple ends.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Extract Brain
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Humanoid with the incapacitated condition. Hit: 45 (10d8) piercing damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the eater of knowledge kills the target by extracting and consuming its brain.

action.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
action.text:
The eater of knowledge casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as its spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15). It must have consumed the requisite number of brains to cast the spell, as indicated:
• 1/Day each: plane shift (self only, 0 brains), detect magic (1 brain), silent image (2 brains), invisibility (3 brains), hypnotic pattern (4 brains), major image (5 brains), telekinesis (6 brains), arcane eye (7 brains), mislead (8 brains), greater invisibility (9 brains), mass suggestion (10 or more brains)

monster.spells: plane shift, detect magic, silent image, invisibility, hypnotic pattern, major image, telekinesis, arcane eye, mislead, greater invisibility, mass suggestion

monster.name: Equinal Guardinal
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 33, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Turn of Fortune's Wheel

trait.name: Headfirst Charge
trait.text: If the equinal moves at least 30 feet in a straight line toward a creature and ends within 5 feet of it, that creature must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or take 14 (4d6) bludgeoning damage and have the prone condition.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The equinal makes two Fist attacks.

action.name: Fist
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) radiant damage.

action.name: Rock
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, range 60/180 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or have the prone condition.

action.name: Shout (Recharge 6)
action.text: The equinal lets out a booming shout. Each creature within 30 feet of the equinal must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or have the stunned condition until the end of the equinal's next turn.

monster.name: Eyestalk of Gzemnid
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Turn of Fortune's Wheel p. 88

trait.name: Tunneler
trait.text: The eyestalk can burrow through solid rock at half its burrow speed and leaves a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The eyestalk uses Eradication Gaze, if available, and makes one Bite attack.

action.name: Bite
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (3d8 + 9) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the eyestalk. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the eyestalk, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the eyestalk's turns.
If the eyestalk takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the eyestalk must succeed on a DC 21 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the eyestalk. If the eyestalk dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 20 feet of movement, exiting prone.

action.name: Eradication Gaze (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The eyestalk creates an area of magical devastation in a 150-foot cone. Any creature in that area must succeed on a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw or take 55 (10d10) necrotic damage. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, its body becomes a pile of fine violet dust.

monster.name: Farastu Demodand
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 26, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Turn of Fortune's Wheel

trait.name: Boundless Movement
trait.text: The farastu ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can't reduce its speed. It can spend 5 feet of movement to automatically remove the grappled condition from itself.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The farastu has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The farastu can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The farastu makes two Claw attacks and one Bite attack.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) slashing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the grappled condition (escape DC 15, with disadvantage). The farastu has two claws, each of which can grapple one creature.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit (with advantage against a creature the farastu is grappling), reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) piercing damage plus 24 (7d6) acid damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The farastu casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability:
• At will: invisibility (self only) • 1/Day each: dispel magic, fog cloud

action.name: Summon Demodand (1/Day)
action.text: The farastu has a 40 percent chance of summoning 1 farastu demodand. A summoned demodand appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of the farastu, acts as an ally of the farastu, and can't summon other demodands. It remains for 1 minute, until it or the farastu dies, or until the farastu dismisses it as an action.

monster.spells: invisibility, dispel magic, fog cloud

monster.name: Fated Shaker
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 56, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The shaker makes two Golden Rod or Radiant Bolt attacks.

action.name: Golden Rod
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 9 (2d8) radiant damage.

action.name: Radiant Bolt
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d10 + 3) radiant damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The shaker casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14):
• At will: mage armor, mage hand • 1/Day each: enlarge/reduce, fly, suggestion

action.name: Commanding Words (Bonus Action)
action.text:
The shaker speaks magical words to order a creature it can see within 30 feet of itself. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be affected by one of the following effects (choose one or roll a d4):
1-2: Grovel. The target takes 14 (4d6) psychic damage, drops whatever it is holding, and has the prone condition.
3-4: Cower. The target takes 10 (3d6) psychic damage and has the frightened condition until the end of its next turn.

monster.spells: mage armor, mage hand, enlarge/reduce, fly, suggestion

monster.name: Ferrumach Rilmani
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 44, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Turn of Fortune's Wheel

trait.name: Bladed Edges
trait.text: A creature takes 10 (3d6) slashing damage if it starts its turn grappling or being grappled by the ferrumach.

trait.name: Skewering Charge
trait.text: If the ferrumach moves at least 20 feet in a straight line toward a Large or smaller creature and ends within 5 feet of it, that creature must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or have the grappled condition (escape DC 18) and take 10 (3d6) piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The ferrumach makes three Sharpened Limb or Bolt attacks.

action.name: Sharpened Limb
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage plus 11 (2d10) psychic damage.

action.name: Bolt
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 11 (2d10) psychic damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The ferrumach casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14):
• At will: detect magic • 1/Day each: dispel magic, ice storm

monster.spells: detect magic, dispel magic, ice storm

monster.name: Fraternity of Order Law Bender
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 57, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The law bender makes three Arcane Burst attacks and uses Power of Authority or Spellcasting.

action.name: Arcane Burst
action.text: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 90 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d12 + 4) force damage.

action.name: Power of Authority
action.text: The law bender targets a creature it can see within 60 feet of itself. The target must succeed on a DC 16 Intelligence saving throw or take 10 (3d6) psychic damage and have the incapacitated condition for 1 minute. At the end of each of the target's turns, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the incapacitated condition on itself on a success. A target that succeeds on the saving throw becomes immune to this law bender's Power of Authority for 24 hours.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The law bender casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability:
• At will: dispel magic, fly, mage armor, mage hand, prestidigitation

action.name: Spatial Loophole (Bonus Action)
action.text: The law bender teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

reaction.name: Probability Loophole (3/Day)
reaction.text: When the law bender or a creature it can see makes an attack roll, a saving throw, or an ability check, the law bender can cause the roll to be made with advantage or disadvantage.

monster.spells: dispel magic, fly, mage armor, mage hand, prestidigitation

monster.name: Githzerai Futurist
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 30, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Turn of Fortune's Wheel

trait.name: Psychic Defense
trait.text: While the githzerai is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The githzerai makes three Unarmed Strike or Psychic Bolt attacks.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 11 (2d10) psychic damage.

action.name: Psychic Bolt
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, range 60 ft., one creature. Hit: 21 (4d8 + 3) psychic damage.

action.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
action.text:
The githzerai casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):
• At will: dispel magic, levitate (self only), mage hand (the hand is invisible), see invisibility • 1/Day each: plane shift (self only), scrying (as an action), slow, telekinesis

reaction.name: Future Insight (3/Day)
reaction.text: When the githzerai or a creature it can see makes an attack roll, a saving throw, or an ability check, the githzerai can cause the roll to be made with advantage or disadvantage.

monster.spells: dispel magic, levitate, mage hand, see invisibility, plane shift, scrying, slow, telekinesis

monster.name: Githzerai Traveler
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 31, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands

trait.name: Psychic Defense
trait.text: While the githzerai is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The githzerai makes three Unarmed Strike attacks.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 4 (1d8) psychic damage.

action.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
action.text:
The githzerai casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):
• At will: mage hand (the hand is invisible) • 1/Day each: jump, plane shift (self only), see invisibility

action.name: Matter Manipulation (Recharge 4-6) (Bonus Action)
action.text:
The githzerai manipulates the energy of the plane of existence it's on to produce one of the following effects (choose one or roll a d6):
1-2: Astral Step. The githzerai can teleport, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 40 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. In addition, its walking speed increases to 40 feet until the start of its next turn.
3-4: Growth. Flowers and vines grow around the githzerai until the start of its next turn, then vanish; the ground within 15 feet of the githzerai is difficult terrain for other creatures while the flowers and vines are present.
5-6: Retaliating Light. Multicolored lights surround the githzerai until the start of its next turn. For the effect's duration, whenever a creature within 5 feet of the githzerai hits it with a melee attack roll, that creature takes 3 (1d6) force damage, as magic lashes out in retribution.

monster.spells: mage hand, jump, plane shift, see invisibility

monster.name: Githzerai Uniter
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 31, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Turn of Fortune's Wheel

trait.name: Psychic Defense
trait.text: While the githzerai is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The githzerai makes three Unarmed Strike or Psychic Bolt attacks. It can replace any of these attacks with one use of its Pacifying Touch.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) psychic damage.

action.name: Psychic Bolt
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range 60 ft., one creature. Hit: 17 (5d6) psychic damage.

action.name: Pacifying Touch
action.text: The githzerai touches one creature it can see within 5 feet of itself. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Intelligence saving throw, or the githzerai chooses an action for that target: Attack, Cast a Spell, or Dash. The affected target can't take that action for 1 minute. At the end of each of the target's turns, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a successful save. A target that succeeds on the saving throw becomes immune to this githzerai's Pacifying Touch for 24 hours.

action.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
action.text:
The githzerai casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14):
• At will: mage hand (the hand is invisible), see invisibility • 1/Day each: plane shift (self only), telekinesis

monster.spells: mage hand, see invisibility, plane shift, telekinesis

monster.name: Hands of Havoc Fire Starter
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 58, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Turn of Fortune's Wheel

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The fire starter makes two Havoc Hammer or Havoc Flask attacks.

action.name: Havoc Hammer
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 9 (2d8) fire damage. If the target is a creature, magical flames cling to it, causing it to take 3 (1d6) fire damage at the start of each of its turns. Immediately after taking this damage on its turn, the target can make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a successful save.

action.name: Havoc Flask
action.text:
Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d12) fire damage. If the target is a creature, magical flames cling to it, causing it to take 3 (1d6) fire damage at the start of each of its turns. Immediately after taking this damage on its turn, the target can make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a successful save.
After the fire starter throws the flask, roll a d6; on a 3 or lower, the fire starter has no more flasks to throw.

monster.name: Harmonium Captain
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 58, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Turn of Fortune's Wheel

trait.name: Aura of Command
trait.text: Allies within 30 feet of the captain are immune to the charmed and frightened conditions. This aura is suppressed while the captain has the incapacitated condition.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The captain makes three Harmonium Blade attacks. The captain can also use Dictate if available.

action.name: Harmonium Blade
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) lightning damage.

action.name: Dictate (Recharge 5-6)
action.text:
The captain verbally commands up to three creatures it can see within 60 feet of itself. This magical command must be to undertake an action or to refrain from taking actions (for example, "Throw down your weapons").
A target must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or have the charmed condition for 1 minute, during which time it follows the captain's command. The effect ends early if the target takes damage or if it successfully completes the command. A target automatically succeeds on its saving throw if the command is directly harmful to itself, such as commanding it to walk into fire.
A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a successful save.

monster.name: Harmonium Peacekeeper
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 59, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Turn of Fortune's Wheel

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The peacekeeper has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the peacekeeper's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally doesn't have the incapacitated condition.

action.name: Electrified Mancatcher
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) lightning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the grappled condition (escape DC 13). Until the grappled condition ends, the target has the restrained condition and can't teleport, the peacekeeper can't make Electrified Mancatcher attacks, and the target takes 8 (1d10 + 3) lightning damage at the start of each of its turns.

monster.name: Heralds of Dust Remnant
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 59, Adventure Atlas: The Mortuary, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Turn of Fortune's Wheel

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The remnant makes two Necrotic Surge attacks.

action.name: Necrotic Surge
action.text: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d10 + 3) necrotic damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The remnant casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):
• At will: mage armor, mage hand, prestidigitation • 1/Day each: bane, dimension door, web

action.name: Phase (2/Day) (Bonus Action)
action.text: The remnant becomes partially incorporeal for as long as it maintains concentration on the effect (as if concentration on a spell). While partially incorporeal, the remnant has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

monster.spells: mage armor, mage hand, prestidigitation, bane, dimension door, web

monster.name: Hexton Modron
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 37, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Turn of Fortune's Wheel

trait.name: Axiomatic Mind
trait.text: The hexton can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

trait.name: Combat Ready
trait.text: The hexton has advantage on initiative rolls.

trait.name: Disintegration
trait.text: If the hexton dies, its body disintegrates into dust, leaving behind anything it was carrying.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
trait.text: If the hexton fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Reactive
trait.text: The hexton can take up to three reactions per round but only one per turn.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The hexton makes one Pincer attack and two Tentacle attacks.

action.name: Pincer
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) force damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or have the incapacitated condition until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Tentacle
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) piercing damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the grappled condition (escape DC 14). Until this grapple ends, the hexton can't use this tentacle against other targets. The hexton has six tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The hexton casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17):
• At will: detect magic, dispel magic, mending (as an action) • 1/Day each: plane shift (self only), protection from evil and good

reaction.name: Counter Magic
reaction.text: The hexton attempts to interrupt a creature it can see that is casting a spell. If the spell is 3rd level or lower, it fails and has no effect. If the spell is 4th level or higher, the hexton makes an Intelligence check (DC 10 + the spell's level). On a success, the spell fails and has no effect.

reaction.name: Lightning Rebuke
reaction.text: When a creature within 120 feet of the hexton damages it, the hexton magically retaliates with an arc of lightning. The creature must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw, taking 11 (2d10) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.spells: detect magic, dispel magic, mending, plane shift, protection from evil and good

monster.name: Hound Archon
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 16, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Turn of Fortune's Wheel

trait.name: Aura of Menace
trait.text: As long as the archon doesn't have the incapacitated condition, each creature of the archon's choice that starts its turn within 20 feet of the archon must make a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature has the frightened condition until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature is immune to all archons' Aura of Menace for 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The archon makes two Bite attacks. It can replace one of the attacks with a Shining Blade attack.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or have the prone condition.

action.name: Shining Blade (True Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) radiant damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The archon casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability:
• At will: detect evil and good • 1/Day each: aid, continual flame

action.name: Teleport
action.text: The archon teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, to an unoccupied space it can see within 120 feet of itself.

action.name: Change Shape (Bonus Action)
action.text: The archon magically transforms into any Medium or Large dog or wolf while retaining its game statistics (other than its size and losing its Shining Blade attack). The archon reverts to its true form if reduced to 0 hit points or if it uses a bonus action to do so.

monster.spells: detect evil and good, aid, continual flame

monster.name: Kelubar Demodand
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 27, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands

trait.name: Acidic Secretions
trait.text: A creature that touches the kelubar or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 (2d4) acid damage.

trait.name: Boundless Movement
trait.text: The kelubar ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can't reduce its speed. It can spend 5 feet of movement to automatically remove the grappled condition from itself.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The kelubar has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The kelubar makes two Bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (1d10 + 6) piercing damage plus 18 (4d8) acid damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The kelubar casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17):
• At will: invisibility (self only) • 1/Day each: dispel magic, scrying (as an action)

action.name: Spit Acid
action.text: The kelubar spits acid in a line 60 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw, taking 27 (6d8) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Summon Demodand (1/Day)
action.text: The kelubar has a 40 percent chance of summoning its choice of 1d2 farastu demodands or 1 kelubar demodand. A summoned demodand appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of the kelubar, acts as an ally of the kelubar, and can't summon other demodands. It remains for 1 minute, until it or the kelubar dies, or until the kelubar dismisses it as an action.

action.name: Nauseating Fog (Recharge 6) (Bonus Action)
action.text: The kelubar magically creates a cloud of greenish fog that fills a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within 120 feet of itself. The cloud remains for 1 minute or until the kelubar uses this bonus action again. The cloud is heavily obscured and difficult terrain. Any creature that starts its turn in the cloud or enters the cloud for the first time on a turn must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or have the poisoned condition until the end of its next turn.

monster.spells: invisibility, dispel magic, scrying

monster.name: Kolyarut
monster.resist: thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, poisoned, unconscious
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 34, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Turn of Fortune's Wheel

trait.name: Immutable Form
trait.text: The kolyarut is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
trait.text: If the kolyarut fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The kolyarut has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The kolyarut makes four Unerring Blade attacks.

action.name: Unerring Blade
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: automatic hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 24 force damage plus one of the following effects (choose one or roll a d6):
1-2: Disarm. The target drops one item it is holding of the kolyarut's choice
3-4: Imbalance. The target can't take reactions until the start of the kolyarut's next turn.
5-6: Push. If the target is Large or smaller, the target is pushed up to 15 feet away from the kolyarut.

action.name: Edict of Blades (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The kolyarut moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks and can make one Unerring Blade attack against each creature it moves past. Whenever it hits a creature with an Unerring Blade attack during this movement, each spell of 5th level or lower on the creature ends, and the creature has the incapacitated condition until the end of the kolyarut's next turn.

action.name: Plane Shift (3/Day)
action.text: The kolyarut casts plane shift, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability. The kolyarut can cast the spell normally, or it can cast the spell on an unwilling creature it can see within 60 feet of itself. If it uses the latter option, the targeted creature must succeed on a DC 18 Charisma saving throw or be sent to a teleportation circle in the Hall of Concordance in Sigil.

reaction.name: Parry
reaction.text: The kolyarut adds 6 to its AC against one attack roll that would hit it. To do so, the kolyarut must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

monster.name: Lantern Archon
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 17, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Turn of Fortune's Wheel

trait.name: Aura of Menace
trait.text: As long as the archon doesn't have the incapacitated condition, each creature of the archon's choice that starts its turn within 20 feet of the archon must make a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature has the frightened condition until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature is immune to all archons' Aura of Menace for 24 hours.

trait.name: Illumination
trait.text: The archon sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
trait.text: The archon can move through creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. If it ends its turn inside an object, it takes 5 (1d10) force damage.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The archon makes two Radiant Strike attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Teleport.

action.name: Radiant Strike
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) radiant damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The archon casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability:
• At will: detect evil and good • 1/Day: aid

action.name: Teleport
action.text: The archon teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, to an unoccupied space it can see within 120 feet of itself.

action.name: Shift Radiance (Bonus Action)
action.text: The archon reduces its Illumination to shed only dim light in a 5-foot radius, or it returns the light to full intensity.

monster.spells: detect evil and good, aid

monster.name: Maelephant
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 35, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Turn of Fortune's Wheel

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The maelephant has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The maelephant makes one Barbed Trunk attack and two Glaive attacks.

action.name: Barbed Trunk
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage plus 13 (2d12) poison damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the grappled condition (escape DC 14). Until this grapple ends, the target has the restrained condition. While it is grappling a creature, the maelephant can't use its barbed trunk to attack other creatures.

action.name: Glaive
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Mind Poison (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The maelephant expels poisonous gas from its trunk in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 39 (6d12) poison damage and has the poisoned condition. While poisoned in this way, the creature loses all weapon and skill proficiencies, it can't cast spells, it can't understand language, and it has disadvantage on Intelligence saving throws. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only and is immune to this maelephant's Mind Poison for 24 hours.

monster.name: Mercykiller Bloodhound
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 60, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Turn of Fortune's Wheel

trait.name: Portal Sense
trait.text: The bloodhound can sense the presence of portals within 30 feet of itself, including inactive portals, and instinctively knows the destination of each portal.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The bloodhound makes three Clawed Gauntlet attacks.

action.name: Clawed Gauntlet
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage.

action.name: Marked for Pursuit (3/Day) (Bonus Action)
action.text: The bloodhound attempts to place a magical mark on a creature it can see within 30 feet of itself. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Charisma saving throw or become cursed for 24 hours. A creature missing any of its hit points has disadvantage on this saving throw. While cursed in this way, the bloodhound can sense the direction and distance to the target as long as the two are on the same plane of existence. If the target isn't on the same plane, the bloodhound knows what plane the target is on.

monster.name: Mind's Eye Matter Smith
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 60, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Turn of Fortune's Wheel

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The matter smith makes two Manifested Force attacks.

action.name: Manifested Force
action.text: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) force damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The matter smith casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability:
• At will: mage armor, mage hand, prestidigitation • 1/Day each: create food and water, fabricate (as an action)

action.name: Planar Smithing (Bonus Action)
action.text:
The matter smith magically manipulates the energy of the plane of existence it's on to produce one of the following effects (choose one or roll a d4):
1-2: Chains: The matter smith creates spectral bindings around a creature it can see within 30 feet of itself. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or have the restrained condition until the end of its next turn.
3-4: Magic Shield: The matter smith conjures a floating, spectral shield that grants the matter smith a +5 bonus to its AC until the shield disappears at the start of the matter smith's next turn. The first time a creature misses a melee attack roll against the matter smith while the shield is conjured, that creature takes 7 (2d6) force damage.

monster.spells: mage armor, mage hand, prestidigitation, create food and water, fabricate

monster.name: Morte
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Turn of Fortune's Wheel p. 10, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

monster.name: Musteval Guardinal
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 33, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Turn of Fortune's Wheel

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The musteval makes two Bone Blade attacks.

action.name: Bone Blade
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) radiant damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The musteval casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability:
• At will: dancing lights • 1/Day each: disguise self, invisibility

reaction.name: Skirmish Movement
reaction.text: When a creature ends its turn within 5 feet of the musteval, the musteval can move up to half its speed. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

monster.spells: dancing lights, disguise self, invisibility

monster.name: Nonaton Modron
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 38, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Turn of Fortune's Wheel

trait.name: Axiomatic Mind
trait.text: The nonaton can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

trait.name: Combat Ready
trait.text: The nonaton has advantage on initiative rolls.

trait.name: Disintegration
trait.text: If the nonaton dies, its body disintegrates into dust, leaving behind anything it was carrying.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The nonaton makes three Arm attacks and uses Pillar of Truth or Spellcasting.

action.name: Arm
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the grappled condition (escape DC 14). Until this grapple ends, the nonaton can't use this arm against other targets. The nonaton has nine arms, each of which can grapple one target.

action.name: Pillar of Truth
action.text: The nonaton chooses a point on the ground that it can see within 60 feet of itself. A 60-foot-tall, 20-foot-radius cylinder of magical force rises from that point. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 21 (6d6) force damage, and the creature reverts to its original form (if it's in a different form) and can't assume a different form until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The nonaton casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):
• At will: detect magic, dispel magic, mending (as an action) • 1/Day each: plane shift (self only), protection from evil and good

monster.spells: detect magic, dispel magic, mending, plane shift, protection from evil and good

monster.name: Octon Modron
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 40, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands

trait.name: Axiomatic Mind
trait.text: The octon can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

trait.name: Combat Ready
trait.text: The octon has advantage on initiative checks.

trait.name: Disintegration
trait.text: If the octon dies, its body disintegrates into dust, leaving behind anything it was carrying.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The octon makes three Tentacle attacks.

action.name: Tentacle
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 9 (2d8) lightning damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The octon casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):
• At will: detect magic, dispel magic, mending (as an action) • 1/Day each: plane shift (self only), protection from evil and good

action.name: Whirlwind of Tentacles (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The octon rapidly extends and spins its ring of tentacles. Each creature within 20 feet of the octon must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 10 feet in a straight line toward the octon. Then, the octon makes two Tentacle attacks against each creature within 10 feet of itself.

monster.spells: detect magic, dispel magic, mending, plane shift, protection from evil and good

monster.name: Planar Incarnate
monster.immune: necrotic, poison, radiant; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, restrained, stunned, unconscious
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 41

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If the incarnate fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The incarnate has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Planar Form
trait.text: An incarnate on the Upper Planes is a Celestial. An incarnate on the Lower Planes is a Fiend.

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: The incarnate deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The incarnate makes two Slam or Energy Bolt attacks.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 27 (3d12 + 8) force damage.

action.name: Energy Bolt
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +12 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 32 (5d12) necrotic damage if the incarnate is a Fiend or radiant damage if the incarnate is a Celestial.

action.name: Planar Exhalation (Recharge 5-6)
action.text:
The incarnate exhales concentrated energy native to its plane in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 23 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 52 (8d12) necrotic damage if the incarnate is a Fiend or radiant damage if the incarnate is a Celestial, and the creature has the blinded condition until the end of the incarnate's next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.
Blinded: • A blinded creature can't see and automatically fails any ability check that requires sight. • Attack rolls against the creature have advantage, and the creature's attack rolls have disadvantage.

monster.name: Razorvine Blight
monster.senses: blindsight 60 ft. (can't see beyond this radius)
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 42, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: If the blight is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. If a creature hasn't observed the blight move or act, that creature must succeed on a DC 18 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the blight is animate.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The blight can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The blight makes two Claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit (with advantage if the target is missing any of its hit points), reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

action.name: Life-Draining Vines (Recharge 6)
action.text: Snaking vines erupt from the blight. Each creature within 10 feet of it must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 9 (2d8) slashing damage on failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If at least one of the creatures that failed this save isn't a Construct or an Undead, the blight regains 9 hit points.

monster.name: Septon Modron
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 40, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Turn of Fortune's Wheel

trait.name: Axiomatic Mind
trait.text: The septon can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

trait.name: Combat Ready
trait.text: The septon has advantage on initiative checks.

trait.name: Disintegration
trait.text: If the septon dies, its body disintegrates into dust, leaving behind anything it was carrying.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The septon makes four Tentacle attacks and uses Lightning Network or Spellcasting.

action.name: Tentacle
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) piercing damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the grappled condition (escape DC 14). Until this grapple ends, the septon can't use this tentacle against other targets. The septon has seven tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

action.name: Lightning Network
action.text: The septon conjures a field of electricity that fills a 30-foot cube originating from itself before dissipating. Each creature in that area must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 33 (6d10) lightning damage and has the stunned condition for 1 minute. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only. A stunned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The septon casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16):
• At will: detect magic, dispel magic, mending (as an action) • 1/Day each: plane shift (self only), protection from evil and good, sending

monster.spells: detect magic, dispel magic, mending, plane shift, protection from evil and good, sending

monster.name: Shator Demodand
monster.languages: Abyssal, Common, Demodand, Infernal, telepathy 120 ft.
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 28, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands

trait.name: Boundless Movement
trait.text: The shator ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can't reduce its speed. It can spend 5 feet of movement to automatically remove the grappled condition from itself.

trait.name: Jailer (1/Day)
trait.text: The shator can cast the imprisonment spell, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (chaining effect only; spell save DC 18).

trait.name: Liquefaction Ritual
trait.text: The shator can perform a 1-minute ritual that turns all willing farastus and kelubars of its choice within 60 feet of itself into a living liquid form. Each liquefied demodand becomes enough liquid to fill a flask. A demodand's liquefaction lasts until a shator uses an action to end it or a creature opens a container holding the liquid. While liquefied in this way, a demodand has the paralyzed condition despite any immunity to that condition, it has immunity to all damage, and any curse affecting it is suspended.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The shator has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Numbing Secretions
trait.text: A creature that touches the shator or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it must succeed on a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw or have disadvantage on attack rolls and its speed halved until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The shator makes one Bite attack and two Enervating Trident attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (3d6 + 7) piercing damage plus 26 (4d12) acid damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or have the paralyzed condition until the start of the shator's next turn.

action.name: Enervating Trident
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (2d10 + 7) necrotic damage.

action.name: Inhibitory Spray (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The shator exhales a spray of slime in a line 100 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw.
