On a failed save, a creature takes 40 (9d8) acid damage and has the paralyzed condition for 1 minute. The creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The shator casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 18, +10 to hit with spell attacks):
• At will: invisibility (self only), suggestion • 1/Day each: dispel magic, plane shift (to Carceri only), scrying (as an action)

action.name: Summon Demodand (1/Day)
action.text: The shator has a 50 percent chance of summoning its choice of 1d4 farastu demodands, 1d2 kelubar demodands, or 1 shator demodand. A summoned demodand appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of the shator, acts as an ally of the shator, and can't summon other demodands. It remains for 1 minute, until it or the shator dies, or until the shator dismisses it as an action.

monster.spells: invisibility, suggestion, dispel magic, plane shift, scrying

monster.name: Shemeshka
monster.resist: cold, fire, lightning; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 46, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Turn of Fortune's Wheel

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Shemeshka carries a magic crown called the Razorvine Tiara. In the hands of anyone other than Shemeshka, the Razorvine Tiara functions as a tentacle rod that deals slashing damage instead of bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
trait.text: If Shemeshka fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Shemeshka has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Shemeshka uses Arcane Flux or Spellcasting. She then makes one Claw attack or one attack with her Razorvine Tiara.

action.name: Arcane Flux
action.text: Shemeshka causes a surge of arcane energy to burst around one creature she can see within 120 feet of herself. The target must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 45 (7d12) force damage and has the incapacitated condition until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d4 + 5) slashing damage plus 14 (4d6) poison damage.

action.name: Razorvine Tiara
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (3d6) slashing damage plus 9 (2d8) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, or its speed is halved and it has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
Shemeshka casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 18):
• At will: alter self, darkness, invisibility (self only), mage hand, prestidigitation • 2/Day each: detect thoughts, dimension door, suggestion • 1/Day each: banishment, contact other plane (as an action), mind blank

action.name: Teleport (Bonus Action)
action.text: Shemeshka teleports, along with any equipment she is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space she can see.

reaction.name: Fell Counterspell (3/Day)
reaction.text: Shemeshka utters a magical word to interrupt a creature she can see that is casting a spell. If the spell is 5th level or lower, it fails and has no effect. If the spell is 6th level or higher, Shemeshka makes an Intelligence check (DC 10 + the spell's level). On a success, the spell fails and has no effect. Whatever the spell's level, the caster gains the poisoned condition until the end of its next turn.

monster.spells: alter self, darkness, invisibility, mage hand, prestidigitation, detect thoughts, dimension door, suggestion, banishment, contact other plane, mind blank

monster.name: Society of Sensation Muse
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 61, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Turn of Fortune's Wheel

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
The muse casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):
• At will: dancing lights • 1/Day each: comprehend languages, hypnotic pattern

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The muse makes two Beguiling Resonance attacks.

action.name: Beguiling Resonance
action.text: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 90 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d8) psychic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Charisma saving throw or have disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Enchanting Presence (Bonus Action)
action.text:
Each creature within 30 feet of the muse must make a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature has the charmed condition for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature becomes immune to any muse's Enchanting Presence for 24 hours.
Whenever the muse deals damage to the charmed creature, the charmed creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.spells: dancing lights, comprehend languages, hypnotic pattern

monster.name: Sunfly
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 47, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Turn of Fortune's Wheel

action.name: Sting
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) piercing damage. Additionally, if the sunfly is on an Outer Plane, it injects the target with a toxin, the effect of which is determined by the sunfly's location:
Upper Plane. The target sheds bright light in a 5-foot radius until the end of its next turn.
Neutral Plane. If the target is concentration on a spell or similar effect, it makes the Constitution saving throw with disadvantage to maintain its concentration.
Lower Plane. The target's speed is reduced by 5 feet until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Illumination (Bonus Action)
action.text: The sunfly sheds bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light for an additional 5 feet, or it uses a bonus action to extinguish the light.

monster.name: Swarm of Sunflies
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 47

trait.name: Swarm
trait.text: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny dragonfly. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Stings
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature in the swarm's space. Hit: 10 (3d4 + 3) piercing damage, or 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer. Additionally, if the swarm is on an Outer Plane, it injects the target with a toxin, the effect of which is determined by the swarm's location:
Upper Plane. The target sheds bright light in a 5-foot radius until the end of its next turn. During that time, the invisible condition has no effect on it.
Neutral Plane. If the target is concentration on a spell or similar effect, it loses its concentration.
Lower Plane. The target's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Dazzling Lights (Recharge 6)
action.text: The swarm shines its lights in a dazzling display. Each creature within 15 feet of the swarm must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or have the stunned condition for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Illumination (Bonus Action)
action.text: The swarm sheds bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet, or it uses a bonus action to extinguish the light.

monster.name: Time Dragon Wyrmling
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 51, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Turn of Fortune's Wheel

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The dragon makes three Rend attacks.

action.name: Rend
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) force damage.

action.name: Time Breath (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The dragon exhales a wave of shimmering light in a 15-foot cone. Nonmagical objects and vegetation in that area that aren't being worn or carried crumble to dust. Each creature in that area must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 27 (6d8) force damage and is magically weakened as it is desynchronized from the time stream. While the creature is in this state, attack rolls against it have advantage. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only. A weakened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.name: Transcendent Order Conduit
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 62, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands

trait.name: Instinctive Reflexes
trait.text: The conduit has advantage on initiative rolls, and it can't have disadvantage on attack rolls.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
trait.text: While the conduit is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

trait.name: Reactive
trait.text: The conduit can take up to three reactions per round but only one per turn.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The conduit makes three Unarmed Strike attacks.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, the conduit can choose one of the following additional effects (up to once per turn each):
Incapacitate. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have the incapacitated condition until the end of the conduit's next turn.
Push. The target is pushed up to 10 feet horizontally away from the conduit.

reaction.name: Deflect Attack
reaction.text: In response to being hit by an attack roll, the conduit partially deflects the blow. The damage the conduit takes from the attack is reduced by 1d10.

reaction.name: Don't Be There
reaction.text: When the conduit must make a saving throw, it can move up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks. If its new position moves it out of range or otherwise makes it impossible to be targeted by the effect, the conduit avoids the effect entirely.

monster.name: Transcendent Order Instinct
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 62, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
trait.text: While the instinct is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

trait.name: Reactive
trait.text: The instinct can take up to three reactions per round but only one per turn.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The instinct makes three Unarmed Strike attacks.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Deflect Blow
reaction.text: In response to being hit by a melee attack roll, the instinct partially deflects the blow. The damage the instinct takes from the attack is reduced by 1d6.

monster.name: Vargouille Reflection
monster.languages: understands Abyssal, Infernal, and any languages it knew before becoming a vargouille, but it can't speak
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 52, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Turn of Fortune's Wheel

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The vargouille has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) psychic damage.

action.name: Abyssal Curse
action.text: The vargouille targets one Humanoid within 5 feet of itself that has the incapacitated condition. The target must succeed on a DC 12 Charisma saving throw or become cursed. The cursed target's Charisma decreases by 1 after each hour, as its head takes on fiendish aspects, and its Charisma can't increase. The curse doesn't advance while the target is in sunlight or the area of a daylight spell. When the cursed target's Charisma becomes 2, the target dies, and its head tears from its body and becomes a new vargouille reflection. Casting remove curse, greater restoration, or a similar spell on the target before the transformation is complete ends the curse and restores the target's Charisma.

action.name: Horrific Reflection (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The vargouille's head mimics that of a Humanoid the vargouille can see within 120 feet of itself. The target must succeed on a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw or take 10 (3d6) psychic damage and have the frightened condition for 1 hour or until the vargouille loses concentration (as if concentration on a spell). If the target's saving throw is successful or if the effect ends on it, the target is immune to the Horrific Reflection of all vargouille reflections for 1 hour.

monster.name: Warden Archon
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 18, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Sigil and the Outlands, Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Turn of Fortune's Wheel

trait.name: Aura of Menace
trait.text: As long as the archon doesn't have the incapacitated condition, each creature of the archon's choice that starts its turn within 20 feet of the archon must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature has the frightened condition until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature is immune to all archons' Aura of Menace for 24 hours.

trait.name: Eternal Vigil
trait.text: The archon can't be surprised. Moreover, it knows when any creature uses a portal it is assigned to guard.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The archon makes two Claw attacks and one Tracker's Bite attack.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, the target has the grappled condition (escape DC 18). The archon can have only one creature grappled in this way at a time.

action.name: Tracker's Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (3d6 + 5) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, for the next 24 hours, the archon knows the distance and direction to the target while they are both on the same plane of existence.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The archon casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):
• At will: detect evil and good • 1/Day each: aid, continual flame, protection from evil and good, scrying (as an action)

action.name: Teleport
action.text: The archon teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, to an unoccupied space it can see within 120 feet of itself.

monster.spells: detect evil and good, aid, continual flame, protection from evil and good, scrying

monster.name: Young Time Dragon
monster.description: Source: Planescape: Adventures in the Multiverse - Morte's Planar Parade p. 51

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The dragon makes three Rend attacks.

action.name: Rend
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) force damage.

action.name: Time Breath (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The dragon exhales a wave of shimmering light in a 30-foot cone. Nonmagical objects and vegetation in that area that aren't being worn or carried crumble to dust. Each creature in that area must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 31 (7d8) force damage and is magically weakened as it is desynchronized from the time stream. While the creature is in this state, attack rolls against it have advantage. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only. A weakened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself after it succeeds on two of these saves.
